title: Behavior of function from graph of derivative

content.question: The graph of f', the derivative of the function f, is shown in the figure above. Which of the following statements about f at x = -2 is true?

choices.label: f is not continuous at x = -2.
f has an absolute maximum at x = -2.
The derivative of f does not exist at x = -2.
The graph of f has a point of inflection at x = -2.
The graph of f has a vertical tangent line at x = -2.

content.answer: The graph of f has a point of inflection at x = -2.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
